document_data.mainbody: '''Alabaster Stonecrafts''' was a stonemason's workshop in the [[Tumbledown]] neighborhood of [[Baldur's Gate]]'s [[Outer City]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Alabaster Stonecrafts was an open-air workshop with tarps stretched overhead to offer some protection from the elements. The workshop's name was stamped on the tarp, announcing itself to passebys.
document_data.History: The workshop was run by [[dwarf]] twins who went by "Sister Alabaster" and "Brother Alabaster." The twins happily whistled as they chiselled at the stone. They enjoyed sniping teasing remarks at each other. On [[Kythorn 28]] of the {{YearlinkName|1477}}, Alabaster Stonecrafts was visited by [[Tav]], an adventuring detective who was investigating a series of grizzly murders. One of the dead bodies was fished out of the [[River Chionthar]], wrapped in a tarp taken from one of the workshops on Misty Court. Or it were the [[ghost]]s if Brother Alabaster was to be believed.
